content: Bus terminal located in Tuas, Singapore **Tuas Bus Terminal** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese): 大士巴士终站) is a [bus terminal](/wiki/Bus_terminus) located in [Tuas](/wiki/Tuas) in the western part of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). This terminal serves industrial workers at Jurong Industrial Estate and Tuas Industrial Estate from [Boon Lay Bus Interchange](/wiki/Boon_Lay_Bus_Interchange). It is connected to the [Tuas Link MRT station](/wiki/Tuas_Link_MRT_station), allowing for convenient transfers. ## History The terminal was relocated to a new site above the [Tuas Depot](/wiki/Tuas_Depot) on 7 October 2017. On 18 June 2017, 2 new services, Bus Services 247 and 248, were introduced in conjunction with the Tuas West MRT Extension opening. On 7 October 2017, all 4 services were relocated to the new site. In January 2024, a contract was awarded to [TOA Corporation](/wiki/TOA_Corporation) for the construction of the Tuas Transport Hub, serving as a new bus terminal for the area. Construction of the bus terminal is projected to be completed in April 2025. ## Bus Contracting Model Under the [Bus Contracting Model](/wiki/Bus_contracting_model_of_Singapore), all bus services operating from Tuas Bus Terminal are under Jurong West Bus Package, operated by the anchor operator, [SMRT Buses Ltd](/wiki/SMRT_Buses). ### List of Bus Services OperatorPackageRoutes**SMRT Buses**Jurong West192, 193, 247, 248 & 248M - Interchanges and Terminals (SBS Transit) This Singapore bus-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Tuas Bus Terminal
